describe: Samoa is a Polynesian island country consisting of two main islands, Upolu and Savai'i, and several smaller islands. Known for its rich cultural heritage, stunning natural landscapes, and vibrant traditions, Samoa offers a unique blend of tropical beauty and warm hospitality.

cities.name: üèù Apia
cities.geographical_location: Located on the central north coast of Upolu Island.
cities.climate: Tropical rainforest climate with consistent temperatures and high humidity year-round.
cities.famous_cuisine: Oka (raw fish in coconut cream), Palusami (taro leaves with coconut cream), and Fa'apapa (sweet coconut bread).

cities.name: üèù Salelologa
cities.geographical_location: Situated on the southeastern coast of Savai'i Island.
cities.climate: Tropical climate with a wet season from November to April and a dry season from May to October.
cities.famous_cuisine: Luau (taro leaves with coconut cream and meat), Pisua (Samoan pudding), and Taro dishes.
